ing: 1 pinch salt, or more to taste
des: "This is a wonderful way to use up the rhubarb in your garden without going to the trouble of making pie. It is more of a savory oatmeal instead of sweet. My children love this for breakfast and get excited when I make it!"
ins: Combine water, salt, and rhubarb in a saucepan; bring to a boil. Add oats and cinnamon. Reduce heat to low; cover and cook, stirring occasionally, 5 to 8 minutes. Remove from heat; stir in flaxseed meal, honey, coconut oil, and chia seeds.
